content: the forearm cuff to the finger ribbing ~ the main color is utilized for the forearm cuff and the top part of the hand and the ribbing ~ directions are the same for both the right and the left hand mittens ~ the first number given is for the small size with medium and large in parenthesis ~ if you prefer a longer mitten work additional rounds prior to the wrist section there is a notation within the directions for this option ~ mittens pictured are made in a size medium ~ there is an option to make the finger ribbing longer to fully cover your fingers and then fold it back when you are not quite as cold ~ the mitten has a snug fit over your wrist and hand consider going up a size in needle if you prefer a looser fit sts = stitches rs = right side mc = main color cc = contrast color pm = place marker sm = slip marker ssk = slip a stitch as if to knit slip the next stitch as if to knit put the left hand needle into the front of the two slipped stitches on the right hand needle and knit them together m1 = make a stitch by picking up the bar between the stitch just worked and the next one on the left hand needle knit through the back loop so there is no gap increase k2 x p2 ribbing = knit two stitches then purl two stitches repeat across round k1 x p1 ribbing = knit one stitch then purl one stitch repeat across round moss stitch over an even number of stitches rounds 1 & 2 *k1 p1 repeat from * rounds 3 & 4 *p1 k1 repeat from * ~ repeat rounds 1 - 4 directions cuff ribbed cuff ~ with mc cast on 64 68 72 sts ~ divide stitches between the two needles to work in the magic loop method of knitting in the round join into the round being careful not to twist sts ~ work the following ribbing round ribbing round 1 *k2 x p2* repeat 16 17 18 times ~ repeat this round a total of 25 times to create the ribbing for the cuff 2 from cast on edge ~ continue to the cuff stockinette stitch/decreases section 3 © 2026 helen bingham designs this pattern may not be copied and the finished garment may not be sold forgotten gem mittens cuff stockinette stitch/decreases notations ● the mc is utilized throughout this section the first cc is used in the striped cuff and wrist section ● the first set of decreases are completed after 55 rounds the 2rd 3rd and 4th sets of decreases are completed after the subsequent 7 rounds ● four stitches are decreased on each decrease round ● 7 rounds are worked after the last set of decreases ● this is when additional length may be added to the mitten if desired ~ work
